pl.polsl.java.proj1.model

Class FermatTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • pl.polsl.java.proj1.model.FermatTest

  • public class FermatTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that performs Fermat's test of primality on a specific level of probability. Tests are performed on numeric values represented by String type.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    MarczykLAP

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private static class  FermatTest.Parity
      Represents parity of a number.

    • Field Detail

      • testedNumber

        private java.lang.String testedNumber
        The number that is being tested for primality. It is the "p" number in following formula: a^(p-1) mod p.

      • testedOnNumber

        private java.lang.String testedOnNumber
        Test is made for specific number. It is the "a" number in following formula: a^(p-1) mod p. "a" has to be within numerical interval which stands for: a is higher or equal 1, but is lower than p.

      • result

        private boolean result
        Result of the test.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FermatTest

        public FermatTest()
        Non-parametric constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateFermatTest

        public void calculateFermatTest()
                         throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException
        Procedure performs Fermat's test for currently set reference value.
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - if action is taken on characters that are not digits.

      • generateRandomNumber

        public void generateRandomNumber()
        Procedure generates random reference value required to perform Fermat test.

      • setNumber

        public void setNumber(java.lang.String numToSet)
               throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException,
                      WrongNumericalIntervalException
        Procedure sets value of the number that has to be tested for primality.
        Parameters:
        numToSet - String which has to be set.
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - If input string includes non-digit characters.
        WrongNumericalIntervalException - If input string value is not in the right numerical interval.

      • setTestOnNumber

        public void setTestOnNumber(java.lang.String numToSet)
                     throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException,
                            WrongNumericalIntervalException
        Procedure sets value of the number that primality test requires to be performed. It is the "a" in following formula: (a^(p-1)) mod p.
        Parameters:
        numToSet - String which has to be set.
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - If input string includes non-digit characters.
        WrongNumericalIntervalException - If string value exceeds the value of number which is going to be tested, or when its less than 1.

      • getResult

        public boolean getResult()
        Getter of the result of Fermat's test.
        Returns:
        returns actually stored result of Fermat's test.

      • getNumber

        public java.lang.String getNumber()
        Getter of the number that is being checked for primality.
        Returns:
        returns actually stored number of Fermat's test.

      • getTestedOnNumber

        public java.lang.String getTestedOnNumber()
        Getter of the number according to which primality test is performed.
        Returns:
        returns actually stored reference value required to perform the Fermat's test.

      • fastModularExponentiation

        private java.lang.String fastModularExponentiation(java.lang.String a,
                                                   java.lang.String p,
                                                   java.lang.String m)
                                            throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException
        Function performs algorithm of fast modular exponentiation given by formula: ((a^p) mod m) on numeric only values represented as Strings.
        Parameters:
        a - in the formula: ((a^p) mod m)
        p - in the formula: ((a^p) mod m)
        m - in the formula: ((a^p) mod m)
        Returns:
        result of the algorithm
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - if conversion to binary will receive non-digit character.

      • moduloOperation

        private java.lang.String moduloOperation(java.lang.String firstNum,
                                         java.lang.String secondNum)
        Function performs modulo operation on two Strings that should represent a numeric unsigned value.
        Parameters:
        firstNum - value that is being divided
        secondNum - the divider
        Returns:
        operation of modulo division.

      • deleteInsignificantZeroes

        private java.lang.String deleteInsignificantZeroes(java.lang.String inputString)
        Function deletes insignificant zeros in String that should represent a numeric unsigned value.
        Parameters:
        inputString - value to perform action on.
        Returns:
        value without insignificant zeros.

      • arrayIntToString

        private java.lang.String arrayIntToString(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> inputArray)
        Function converts array of Integer values to String without insignificant zeros.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - is ArrayList of Integer type.
        Returns:
        String that represents a numeric value without insignificant zeros.

      • arrayBoolToString

        private java.lang.String arrayBoolToString(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> inputArray)
        Function converts array of Boolean values to String without insignificant zeros.
        Parameters:
        inputArray - is ArrayList of Boolean type.
        Returns:
        String that represents a numeric value without insignificant zeros.

      • decimalDimidiation

        private java.lang.String decimalDimidiation(java.lang.String value)
                                     throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException
        Function performs decimal dimidiation algorithm on a numeric value represented by String. Value should be unsigned.
        Parameters:
        value - numeric value represented by String that should be unsigned.
        Returns:
        decimal value divided by two as a String. not-digit Char in function parameter.
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - if elementary operation of dimidiation is being taken on character that is not a digit.

      • writtenAdding

        private java.lang.String writtenAdding(java.lang.String firstNum,
                                       java.lang.String secondNum)
        Function performs basic written method of adding on two unsigned values represented as String
        Parameters:
        firstNum - first number of operation
        secondNum - second number of operation
        Returns:
        result of adding

      • writtenSubtracting

        private java.lang.String writtenSubtracting(java.lang.String firstNum,
                                            java.lang.String secondNum)
        Function performs basic written method of subtracting on two unsigned values represented as String. It does not support unsigned values and does not return such ones.
        Parameters:
        firstNum - first number of operation, String should consist only of numbers and represent a unsigned numeric value
        secondNum - second number of operation, same requirements as firstNum
        Returns:
        result of subtracting. If the firstNum is lower than the secondNum, then the result is the firstNum.

      • compareValues

        private int compareValues(java.lang.String firstString,
                          java.lang.String secondString)
        Function compares two strings which should represent unsigned numeric value.
        Parameters:
        firstString - value that is compared to the other one
        secondString - value that the first one is compared to
        Returns:
        returns 0 as a String if strings are equal numeric value, 1 if the firstString is greater than the secondString, -1 if the firstString is lower than the secondString.

      • multiplying

        private java.lang.String multiplying(java.lang.String multiplier,
                                     java.lang.String multiplicant)
        Function multiplies two numeric values represented by Strings that should be unsigned
        Parameters:
        multiplier - first value of multiplying, is the iterator of adding loop
        multiplicant - second value of multiplying, is the one that is being added specific number of times
        Returns:
        result of multiplying two unsigned values as a String

      • squareStringValue

        private java.lang.String squareStringValue(java.lang.String toSquare)
        Function squares numeric value represented by String
        Parameters:
        toSquare - is the value to be squared.
        Returns:
        square of the value input as a String

      • decToBin

        private java.lang.String decToBin(java.lang.String valueToConvert)
                           throws NotNumericUnsignedValueException
        Function uses decimal dimidiation algorithm and div by 2 with remainder algorithm to convert decimal unsigned value represented as String to binary value.
        Parameters:
        valueToConvert - numeric value represented by String, should be unsigned.
        Returns:
        binary representation in String of the decimal input value. dimidiation on not numeric-only String.
        Throws:
        NotNumericUnsignedValueException - if decimal dimidiation is not performed on a digit.
